[[File:Track works dulwhich hill constitution road overpass.jpg|thumb|upright|Trackwork near the future Arlington stop; Johnson Park is on the left]] '''Arlington MLR station''' is a planned light rail stop on the [[Metro Light Rail]] line in [[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]], [[Australia]] located in the suburb of [[Dulwich Hill, New South Wales|Dulwich Hill]] - adjacent to Constitution Road and Johnson Park. The stop is planned for completion in 2012. The stop's name is a reference to the nearby Arlington Recreation Ground (Oval) - a local sports venue.[http://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/sites/default/files/publications/SLRE-Preliminary-Environmental-Assessment.pdf Sydney Light Rail Extension - Stage 1 - Inner West Extension - Preliminary Environmental Assessment.] Appendix A. Transport NSW. The extension will make use of the former Rozelle branch of the [[Metropolitan Goods railway line]] heavy rail freight corridor and operate from the current light rail terminus at [[Lilyfield MLR station|Lilyfield]] to [[Dulwich Hill Interchange MLR station|Dulwich Hill]].http://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/rail/lightrail-extension.htmlhttp://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/sites/default/file/rail/SLRE-Community-Update-July-August-2010.pdf The stop is estimated to be used by 185 boarding passengers per weekday by 2016. This is the lowest patronage of any stop on the extension.[http://majorprojects.planning.nsw.gov.au/files/61649/08_Environmental%20Assessment%20-%20Volume%201%20-%20Part%20C1%20-%20Chapter%2010.pdf Environmental Assessment - Volume 1 - Part C1 - Chapter 10.] Table 10.1 p 201.
